intro: Impatiens grandispora, commonly known as the large-spore impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has ovate leaves with a smooth texture. Its fruit is a capsule that releases seeds when disturbed, a trait that gives the species its common name. Impatiens grandispora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
